business.headline: Last date for revised ITR is tomorrow, December 31: Will the deadline be extended?There is only one day left to file a revised ITR for the current assessment year. With growing pressure on taxpayers and professionals, many are now wondering whether the Income Tax Department will extend the revised ITR deadline.

BNW unveils Tonino Lamborghini Residences in Ras Al KhaimahBNW Developments introduced the first Tonino Lamborghini Residences in Ras Al Khaimah with a launch attended by celebrities and industry stakeholders.

Only 1 day left for PAN–Aadhaar linking deadline: Are you legally exempt?With December 31 just a day away, taxpayers are running out of time to link PAN with Aadhaar. For most people, the process is mandatory, but some individuals are legally exempt from this requirement.

IndiGo hikes pilot allowances after rostering chaos, flight cancellationsThe revised allowances will come into effect from January 1 and apply across multiple categories, including domestic layover, night operations, deadhead travel and a newly introduced tail-swap allowance.

Explained: Silver's record rally and the China connectionDespite a recent dip, silver is still up more than 150% for the year. Silver prices recently climbed to around $82.5 an ounce, or roughly Rs 254,000 per kg, marking a lifetime high.

Why gold, silver and copper left stocks behind in 2025In a year defined by uncertainty, metals quietly did the heavy lifting, reminding investors that when confidence fades and supply tightens, tangible assets often speak louder than forecasts.
Sensex opens 130 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Tata Steel down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 113.64 points to 84,581.90, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 29.60 points to 25,912.50 as of 9:36 am.

Silver prices today: Why are rates falling and what should investors knowSilver fell 8.7% in a single day, marking its biggest one-day fall since August 2020. This sharp drop cleared some excess heat from a rally that had turned very steep in recent weeks.

Gold, silver rates: Are prices rising or falling today?Gold and silver have seen a very strong rally this year. The sharp rise in silver prices has been driven by supply limits, low stock levels, and strong demand from both industry and investors, while gold has seen a surge due to safe haven demand.

Protests erupt in Iran as currency hits record low, central bank chief quitsIran's largest protests in three years erupted after the rial plunged to a record low, driving up prices, forcing the central bank chief's resignation and intensifying anger over inflation and economic mismanagement.

Indian banking sector shows stability, bad loans fall to multi-decade low: ReportIndia's banking sector has shown resilience in 2025, with strong growth, improved asset quality, and attention to emerging climate risks, according to a recent Reserve Bank of India report.

India's crude oil imports rise in December as Delhi continues buying from MoscowIndia's Russian oil imports are poised to top 1 million barrels per day in December, defying expectations for a sharp decline as refiners have resumed buying from non-sanctioned entities offering deep discounts.

China to cut import tariffs on key commodities and medical supplies in 2026: ReportChina has announced cutting duties on key resource-based materials, including recycled black powder used in lithium-ion batteries.

The uncomfortable truth behind silver's spectacular rallySilver's rise is increasingly being driven not by sentiment or speculation, but by a deep and persistent shortage of physical metal. And that shortage is now reshaping how the market works.

8th Pay Commission: Check key expectations on salary hike, DA, and arrearsWith the 8th Pay Commission set to kick in from January 1, 2026, central government employees and pensioners are keen to know how much their salaries may rise, what could change in Dearness Allowance, and when arrears might be paid.
Sensex ends 346 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Tata Steel up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 345.91 points to end at 84,695.54, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 100.20 points to close at 25,942.10.

Unacademy ESOP move explained: Legal, ethical, or unfair to employees?Over time, ESOPs have become a key pillar of startup compensation in India. However, Unacademy's recent decision to sharply reduce the ESOP exercise window for former employees has forced many to reassess how secure and attractive these options really are.

Hindustan Zinc share price falls 3% after hitting 16-month high. What's next?The stock moved lower later in the session after a strong rally seen over the past few weeks and was trading at Rs 622.80, down 2.21% as of 1:41 PM.

Why withdrawing EPF during a job switch can be a costly financial mistakeFor many salaried Indians, a job switch is exciting but also financially unsettling. Between rent deposits, moving costs and lifestyle adjustments, the temptation to dip into accumulated EPF savings is very real.

Is there any penalty if you file a revised ITR before December 31 deadline?Found an error in your tax return and unsure what to do next? Is there any penalty if you correct it by filing a revised ITR before December 31?

entertainment.headline: Rashmika Mandanna's Rome New Year sparks questions about Vijay Deverakonda Actor Rashmika Mandanna's New Year trip to Rome with Anand Deverakonda intensifies speculation about her private life as sources confirm her upcoming wedding with Vijay Deverakonda in February at a palace in Udaipur.

Malaika Arora opens up about backlash during divorce, admits marrying young Malaika Arora recently spoke about the criticism she faced from her circle during her divorce with Arbaaz Khan. During a podcast with India Today, she also highlighted the enduring stigma surrounding women and divorce.

Shilpa Shetty's year-end post is all about love, family and thankfulness. Video Shilpa Shetty wrapped up 2025 by sharing a heartfelt video on Instagram, featuring cherished moments with her family, vacations and yoga diaries. Expressing gratitude, the actor looked ahead with positivity and big dreams for 2026.

The Princess Bride's Cary Elwes mourns Rob and Michele Reiner in emotional tribute Cary Elwes recalled his bond with Rob Reiner, praising the director's genuine nature, immense love for family, and commitment to finding the best in people. Cary also highlighted Michele Singer Reiner's dedication to charitable causes.

Taylor Swift's Christmas kindness leaves stadium worker in tears Taylor Swift's generosity was on display at Arrowhead Stadium on Christmas Day, where she personally tipped staff and made significant donations to multiple charities, continuing her record of support for both her tour crew and causes aiding families and musicians.

How Ajay Devgn reacted to Akshaye Khanna's abrupt exit from Drishyam 3 Drishyam 3 director Abhishek Pathak shared Ajay Devgn's reaction to Akshaye Khanna's abrupt departure from the film just five days before production was set to begin.

The Raja Saab: Prabhas' Joker look sparks debate, fans recall Arshad Warsi remark The trailer of Prabhas' upcoming film The Raja Saab, released on December 29, has reignited online discussion, with one striking visual drawing attention for its perceived link to an old controversy.

Sunny Deol's emotional moment with Dharmendra's poster at Ikkis screening. Watch The Deol family, still grieving the loss of veteran actor Dharmendra, gathered to attend the screening of Ikkis, the last film featuring the late superstar. Sunny Deol was seen visibly emotional as he stood beside his father's poster, marking a somber moment for the family.

Chinese media targets Salman Khan's Battle of Galwan: Distorting facts Chinese state-run Global Times criticised Salman Khan's Battle of Galwan teaser, accusing the film of "distorting facts" while reiterating Beijing's version of the 2020 Galwan Valley clash.

Show respect to be respected: Bigg Boss 19's Farrhana Bhatt to paps in viral video Farrhana Bhatt recently grabbed headlines after she firmly called out a paparazzo over an inappropriate remark during a public outing. The video, now viral, shows the actor making it clear that while she shares a friendly bond with the media, respect is non-negotiable.

Mohanlal, Mammootty are like Robert De Niro and Al Pacino, says Manoj Bajpayee Manoj Bajpayee praised Mohanlal and Mammootty, comparing them to Hollywood greats Robert De Niro and Al Pacino. His admiration highlighted the unique acting schools and dedication of the Malayalam superstars.

Kim Taehyung: 30 reasons why BTS' V remains K-pop's most understated musician Kim Taehyung, known as V of BTS, stands out in K-pop with his understated artistry, blending jazz influences and emotional depth rather than loud hooks and fast beats. As he turns 30, his music invites listeners to appreciate subtlety and mood, proving that true charisma can whisper and still captivate.

Tu Meri Main Tera struggles at box office, earns Rs 1.75 crore on Day 5 Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri faces a tough box office run, earning only Rs 1.75 crore on day five. The film's total domestic collection reached Rs 25.25 crore, while Dhurandhar continues to lead cinema earnings.

Suriya surprises couple at wedding, bride's priceless reaction goes viral. Watch Suriya made an unexpected appearance at a wedding, fulfilling the bride's dream. A video of the event, where the bride was visibly surprised, has gone viral, sparking reactions from fans on social media.

Vijay Deverakonda, Rashmika Mandanna opt for Udaipur wedding in February: Reports Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are expected to get married in Udaipur in February with close friends and family. The couple reportedly got engaged on October 3.

Stranger Things: Steve Harrington was never meant to be hero, but he became one From high school jock to emotional anchor, Steve Harrington's journey explains why he became the most loved character in Stranger Things and why fans cannot let him go.

George Clooney, wife Amal and children granted French citizenship Hollywood star George Clooney and his family have officially become French citizens. The actor heaped praise on the culture and language.

Hawkins cooker to roller pin: Stranger Things stars try Indian hacks vs Vecna A new Netflix promotional video features Finn Wolfhard and Gaten Matarazzo engaging with Indian household items, sparking widespread online reactions and showcasing the global appeal of 'Stranger Things'.

Rajat Bedi, Gaurav Gera and more: Actors who were back in the spotlight this year Several talented actors impressed with strong roles this year after being away from the limelight for a while. Take a look at the names here.

general news.headline: Khaleda Zia: India-born 'Putul' whose anti-India politics strained ties with DelhiKhaleda Zia: Bangladesh's ties with India have been shaped largely by two leaders - Sheikh Hasina and Khaleda Zia. While Hasina anchored Dhaka firmly to New Delhi, Zia's tenure saw a pivot towards Pakistan and China. Little known, however, is that Zia was born in India.

Will rid Bengal of infiltrators: Amit Shah's poll pitch on Mamata's turfAmit Shah accused the Trinamool Congress government led by Mamata Banerjee of plunging West Bengal into corruption, fear and insecurity due to misgovernance and infiltration, ahead of the Assembly elections.

UP man starved to death, daughter a bag of bones: Servants' greed fuels horrorRetired railway employee Om Prakash Singh Rathore, 70, died of starvation and neglect, while his mentally-challenged daughter, Rashmi was found in a skeletal condition.

US think tank warns India, Pakistan & Afghanistan clashes likely next yearThe US-based think tank, Council on Foreign Relations, has warned that disputes between India, Pakistan and Afghanistan could once again escalate into armed clashes in 2026. The report warned that India and Pakistan were likely to clash over terrorist activity in Kashmir.

The Last Queen: Kota Rani and the Twilight of Hindu KashmirThe Buddhist prince from Ladakh, the refugee who had murdered his own benefactor, Ramachandra, and seized the throne, was gone. He left behind a widow who was also the daughter of the man he had killed, and a son, Haider, who was barely old enough to understand what a throne meant. The power vacuum was immediate and absolute.

Who is Ricky Gill, Trump advisor awarded for India-Pakistan 'ceasefire role'Ranjit 'Ricky' Gill, an Indian-origin adviser to US President Donald Trump, has shot into the limelight after he was awarded for his role in 'negotiating' the ceasefire between India and Pakistan following Operation Sindoor this year.

Priyanka Gandhi's son Raihan Vadra to get engaged to girlfriend Aviva BaigRaihan Vadra, son of Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and Robert Vadra, is set to get engaged to Aviva Baig in a private family event in Rajasthan. The ceremony is planned for early January 2026, keeping the celebrations intimate and away from public attention.

Chinese media targets Salman Khan's Battle of Galwan: Distorting factsChinese state-run Global Times criticised Salman Khan's Battle of Galwan teaser, accusing the film of "distorting facts" while reiterating Beijing's version of the 2020 Galwan Valley clash.

Caught on CCTV: Panic, then horror as BEST bus crushed pedestrians in MumbaiFour people, including three women, died and nine were injured after a reversing bus of Mumbai's civic-run transport undertaking knocked down pedestrians on Monday night.

Pakistan, other Muslim nations unite over Somaliland. What's India's stand?Islamic countries, including Pakistan, have united to oppose Israel's recognition of Somaliland, the Horn of Africa nation that declared independence in 1991. With buzz that Delhi would be next in recognising Somaliland, India's MEA has issued a fact-check. Here's why Somaliland is important geopolitically.

Khaleda Zia: A life that mirrored Bangladesh's tragedyBorn on the eve of Partition and deceased amid political upheaval, Khaleda Zia's life mirrored Bangladesh's turbulent journey through independence, military coups, and a fractured democracy defined by deep-seated rivalry.

Bernie Sanders to Bill Gates, Elon Musk: When AI takes jobs, who pays humans?As AI and robots move closer to replacing most human jobs, US Senator Bernie Sanders is questioning tech billionaires: if machines do the work, who pays the people? He warns that the unchecked automation could lead to mass unemployment and zero income for millions in future.

Sunidhi Chauhan: How a 90s pop star is powering India's Beyonce EraSunidhi Chauhan's concerts are redefining India's live music culture. Nearly three decades in, she is claiming authority on her own terms. This is not a comeback. This is rule from the throne.

Find everything your baby needs this holiday season on Amazon's Everyday EssentialsAs part of the New Year selections, the specially curated New Year Store —available until 31 December 2025—brings up to 50% off across a wide selection of everyday essentials.

Indian immigrants staying locked up at home as US tightens visa screwsImmigrants to the US, including Indians, are avoiding travel even within the country amid the Trump administration's tightening visa restrictions and scrutiny. Such is the fear of not being allowed back into the US that even naturalised citizens are avoiding travel abroad, according to a KFF and NYT survey.

US man in India gets emotional as he bids goodbye to his 'favourite country' in videoA US man shared a heartfelt video bidding farewell to India, calling it his favourite country. His emotional message emphasised the deep impact and unique experiences India offered to visitors.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 9 | The Pundit's Paradoxical PassionRobert Caldwell elevated Tamil literature to its deserving linguistic heights, but emptied it of all the mythological and theological universe contained within it.

Mercedes for drug run, Rs 10,000 to driver per trip: Racket busted in AhmedabadA luxury car used for drug delivery was intercepted on Ahmedabad outskirts, leading to the arrest of three individuals. The main supplier remains absconding as police continue their investigation.

Deeply concerned: PM Modi condemns reports of drone attack on Putin's residencePrime Minister Narendra Modi expressed deep concern over reports of Ukrainian drones targeting Russian President Vladimir Putin's residence near Moscow.

Khaleda Zia's funeral tomorrow, to be buried beside husband Ziaur Rahman Live updatesIn 1960, Khaleda Khanam, who was only 15 years old, married Ziaur Rahman, a young Pakistan Army officer. Following the marriage, she adopted the name Khaleda Zia, taking her husband's first name as her surname.

India becomes top rice producer, but farmers are running out of waterIndia's rise as the leading global rice producer reveals deep groundwater challenges and farmer unease in Punjab and Haryana as policies drive unsustainable practices.

Why the Japanese hair washing method is the internet's new haircare obsessionA slow, scalp-focused hair washing technique from Japan is going viral for the promise of healthier hair. The method is less about products and more about how you wash your hair.

How Ajay Devgn reacted to Akshaye Khanna's abrupt exit from Drishyam 3Drishyam 3 director Abhishek Pathak shared Ajay Devgn's reaction to Akshaye Khanna's abrupt departure from the film just five days before production was set to begin.

Shubman Gill naysayers warned: World Cup snub not the end of his road in T20IsT20 World Cup 2026: Former India cricketer Harbhajan Singh has warned against writing Shubman Gill off in T20Is, saying the star batter has the tools to make a successful return to the side. Gill was left out of India's T20 World Cup side.

sports.headline: Abhishek Sharma was India's best in 2025: Ashwin urges ODI debut for batter Ravichandran Ashwin believes Abhishek Sharma has been India's best performer of 2025. The former spinner also backed the explosive opener for an ODI debut after his game-changing impact in T20Is.

Australia still best team in women's cricket: Gardner ahead of India series Star all-rounder Ashleigh Gardner believes Australia remain the "best team in the world" despite no longer holding the T20 or ODI World Cup titles, and is confident the side will respond strongly when they renew their rivalry with India in February.

After MCG heroics, Josh Tongue named in England provisional squad for T20 World Cup Josh Tongue has been included in England's T20I sqaud for the Sri Lanka tour and the provisional squad for the T20 World Cup. Tongue took a five-wicket haul in Melbourne as England recently beat Australia in an away Test for the first time since 2011.

Watch: Captain Suryakumar visits Tirupati with wife before T20 World Cup India's T20 captain Suryakumar Yadav visited Tirupati temple seeking blessings ahead of the T20 World Cup. His recent batting struggles add pressure as he prepares for crucial upcoming series.

Pakistan Cricket Board parts ways with Test head coach Azhar Mahmood: Report Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has parted ways with the national Test team head coach Azhar Mahmood three months before the expiry of his contract, according to sources.

Don Bradman's Baggy Green from historic home series against India up for auction A rare Baggy Green cap worn by Sir Donald Bradman during the 1947/48 home Test series against India, and later gifted to S.W. Sohoni, will be auctioned publicly for the first time, with strong international interest expected due to its provenance and historical significance.

India's Test report card for 2025: Spark abroad, scars at home, chaos within The doyens retired after a forgettable tour of Australia. A young leader then took charge and showed promise in England. However, a crushing home defeat against South Africa cast a long shadow over the Indian Test team's 2025 report card.

Shubman Gill naysayers warned: World Cup snub not the end of his road in T20Is T20 World Cup 2026: Former India cricketer Harbhajan Singh has warned against writing Shubman Gill off in T20Is, saying the star batter has the tools to make a successful return to the side. Gill was left out of India's T20 World Cup side.

Robert Lewandowski exposes Barcelona's tactics to dodge bonus payments to Bayern Robert Lewandowski has revealed a surprising request from Barcelona during last season's La Liga run-in. The striker said financial concerns led the club to ask him to avoid scoring and triggering a bonus payment.

Coach Sourav Ganguly under early pressure as Pretoria Capitals lose 2 in 2 SA20 2025-26: Sourav Ganguly's Pretoria Capitals have lost their first two matches in the new season. On Monday, they were comfortably outclassed by 48 runs by SunRisers Eastern Cape.

Hardik Pandya to make Test comeback? Robin Uthappa picks all-rounder as ideal no. 7 Robin Uthappa believes Hardik Pandya's Test chapter may not be over yet. The former India batter feels Pandya could return as India's No. 7, provided fitness and workload are carefully managed.

Watch: Gukesh blunders under pressure, loses blitz game to 12-year-old prodigyWorld champion Gukesh Dommaraju suffered a shock blitz defeat in Doha. A late blunder under time pressure allowed 12-year-old prodigy Sergey Sklokin to claim one of the biggest upsets of the World Blitz Championship.

The Pant Paradox: Why India's Test maverick is failing the white-ball testThere is a murmur that Rishabh Pant may be dropped from the ODI side for the New Zealand series in January. Once touted as an all-format star, he now finds himself pushed to a corner. The problem, though, may not be limitation, but excess.

Smriti Mandhana set to overtake Shubman Gill for run-scoring record of 2025Smriti Mandhana is closing in on the biggest batting record of 2025. The India opener needs just 62 more runs to overtake Shubman Gill and become the leading run-scorer across men's and women's international cricket.

Watch: Ronaldo and Djokovic share the stage, respect and lessons to defy ageCristiano Ronaldo praised Novak Djokovic while presenting him the Globe Sports Award in Dubai. The football star highlighted their shared journey of longevity, consistency, and success at the highest level of sport.

Hardly tested, players rested: New faces in focus as India eye 5-0 sweep to end 2025India have sealed the series, but the final T20I offers a chance to test bench strength as youngsters eye debuts, while Sri Lanka look to restore pride after a one-sided campaign in Thiruvananthapuram.

Yonex-Sunrise India Open 2026 to be held in Delhi, tickets start at just Rs 400The Yonex-Sunrise India Open 2026 shifts to the IG Indoor Stadium with tickets starting at Rs 400. Early-bird discounts of up to 50% are available as the Super 750 event returns to Delhi.

Mixed day for CSK uncapped stars: 7 wickets for Ghosh, Aman Khan sets unwanted recordCSK's uncapped players saw contrasting fortunes in the Vijay Hazare Trophy as Ramakrishna Ghosh starred with seven wickets for Maharashtra, while Aman Khan endured a record-breaking spell for Puducherry.

Deja vu for Magnus Carlsen: Watch chess great slam table after loss to Arjun ErigaisiMagnus Carlsen showed visible frustration again, slamming the table after losing to Arjun Erigaisi at World Blitz 2025, echoing a similar reaction following his defeat to D Gukesh earlier this year.

Why Ruben Amorim resisted changing his system early at Manchester UnitedManchester United manager Ruben Amorim said changing the club's formation in response to media pressure would have been "the end" for him, underlining the importance of sticking to his ideas despite intense scrutiny.

WPL: Mumbai Indians appoint Kristen Beams as spin-bowling coachMumbai Indians have added former Australia leg-spinner Kristen Beams to their coaching setup as spin-bowling coach, strengthening the support staff ahead of their WPL 2026 title defence.

Sabalenka, Kyrgios defend 'Battle of the Sexes', see only positives from matchAryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios defended their controversial "Battle of the Sexes" match. Kyrgios called out the media for allegedly spreading negativity.

Anthony Joshua involved in car crash that leaves 2 dead in Nigeria: ReportAnthony Joshua was injured in a car crash on the Ogun–Lagos expressway in Nigeria that left two people dead. The local police reportedly said Joshua sustained minor injuries and is stable.

FIFA president defends 2026 World Cup ticket pricing amid booming demandFIFA President Gianni Infantino defended the ticket prices for next year's World Cup in the United States, Canada and Mexico, pointing to overwhelming demand and the revenue the tournament generates for football around the world.

Rishabh Pant fails as Virat Kohli-less Delhi clinch crucial win vs SaurashtraVijay Hazare Trophy: Virat Kohli's absence did not affect Delhi on Monday, December 29, as they beat Saurashtra to win a key group-stage game. Captain Rishabh Pant failed with the bat in Alur.

Have CSK locked in a BBL star for death bowling? R Ashwin thinks soIPL 2026: Chennai Super Kings will rely heavily on Nathan Ellis for their death bowling in the upcoming season, former spinner R Ashwin has predicted. After releasing Matheesha Pathirana, CSK did not buy death-overs specialists in the auction earlier this month in Abu Dhabi.

Shan Masood eclipses Inzamam-ul-Haq with fastest first-class 200 by Pakistan batterShan Masood sets a new benchmark in Pakistani first-class cricket, achieving a double century in just 177 balls while leading Sui Northern Gas in the President's Cup.

Ashes: Jacob Bethell admits he has more to do to stay England's No.3 in TestsAshes: Jacob Bethell has admitted he still has more to do to cement England's number three spot in Test cricket, despite playing a key role in the Boxing Day victory in Melbourne.

PM Modi congratulates Koneru Humpy, Arjun Erigaisi after World Rapid bronze medalsPrime Minister Narendra Modi has publicly lauded the achievements of Koneru Humpy and Arjun Erigaisi following their bronze medal wins at the FIDE World Rapid Chess Championships in Doha.

Why did Koneru Humpy miss tiebreakers despite being tied for top spot?Koneru Humpy was in with a chance to win the World Rapid title heading into the final round, but a botched Bishop move and the complicated Busscholtz tiebreaker system ensured that the Indian Grandmaster could not win the World Rapid title.

Will Angkrish keep wickets for KKR? Youngster upskills in Vijay HazareVijay Hazare Trophy: Mumbai opener Angkrish Raghuvanshi has been upskilling his wicketkeeping in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Is Angkrish preparing to keep wickets for KKR in IPL 2026?

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
